attributes.comment:
The proposed increases are excessive and will create yet another obstacle for
individuals seeking to adjust their immigration status. The proposed fee
increases will place too heavy a burden on the backs of immigrants, many of whom
cannot shoulder the excessive costs and will be forced to postpone their dreams
of becoming U.S. citizens or remain separated from their families.
The size of the proposed fee increases is particularly troubling since the Bush
administration has indicated that it wants to help immigrants become U.S.
citizens. For example, the current fee to apply for permanent residency is $325;
CIS proposes to raise this fee to $905 (a 178 percent increase). The fee for
naturalization (?citizenship?) applications would increase from $330 to $595 (an
80 percent increase). These exorbitant fees would create undue economic hardship
for many applicants and their family members.
I respectfully urge the USCIS to work with Congressional leaders to identify an
alternative and permanent funding stream that supports USCIS operations.
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Rita Ferreira
